summary: Worker logs a warning when workflow code imports built-in Node modules instead of failing loudly, making it difficult to detect and debug determinism violations. The issue should fail fast rather than silently continuing.
userImpact: Users may unknowingly deploy workflows that import forbidden modules, only discovering the issue at runtime rather than during startup validation.
rootCause: The bundler detects built-in module imports but only logs a warning instead of throwing an error, allowing the worker to start normally.
proposedFix: Change the warning to a loud failure (throw an error) that prevents worker startup when built-in modules are imported, unless explicitly listed in ignoreModules.
workaround: Add the module names to WorkerOptions.bundlerOptions.ignoreModules if the modules are not actually used at runtime.
resolutionDetails: Worker now fails loudly when workflow code imports built-in Node modules, unless they are explicitly whitelisted in bundlerOptions.ignoreModules.
keyQuote: Workflow code doesn't have access to built-in Node modules (in order to help enforce determinism).
